page.title: 14A Local Beat Officer-Sheldon
page.content: Our local beat officer patrols part of Sheldon from east to south of our school. Four beats are in Sheldon. She is Beat Five and works fom Stechford Station. UNIFORM AND EQUIPMENT They have different numbers to identify them. Ladies have a small truncheon and men have a larger one. They also carry a radio to keep in touch. WORKING HOURS She works eight hours a day doing shifts. She gets three- quarters of an hour dinner break.She works seven days, two days off then seven days at work again. She also goes to football matches to patrol there. CHILDREN HELPING POLICE The local beat officer likes talking to children and she does not like them to be afraid of the police. She likes them to cross the road safely and to tell her of any strange things they have seen or heard.
